message.content: Most men in Kashmir have a negative perception of divorce. They generally view divorce as a last resort and believe that it should only be considered in extreme cases. Men in Kashmir tend to prioritize the preservation of the family unit and traditional values, valuing stability and continuity in marriage. They often perceive divorce as a failure and a social stigma, which can bring shame and dishonor to the family. Consequently, most men in Kashmir are inclined to work towards resolving marital issues and maintaining their marriages, rather than opting for divorce.
